intro: Astragalus anguranensis, commonly known as the Anguran milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Afghanistan and Pakistan. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are borne in clusters, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
